channel.title: How to deal with a cheat
channel.description:
[quote="https://www.nairaland.com/nigeria/topic-319829.0.html"] PLEASE GIVE YOUR CANDID ADVISE
I have a girlfriend whom I have dated for two years without sex but i was planning that by december, we will do it.
But just 5days AGO she told me that she has been deflowered by another guy in port harcourt uniport. and this is the guy she had been dating because finance. i told her to stop but she told me knew what she was doing.
She said she is sorry and that she regreted her actions. she said that her friend over there persuaded her to do it. she still claim to love me but i dont understand what kind of love to call this now. i have spent money on this girl yet this how she decided to pay me back.
she will be coming to benin soon to see me. [b]I know one thing for sure is that i am going to beat her for the first time[/b]. but is this the right approach?
Should i forgive her and continue with this relationship. she has agreed to change her number because of this guy.
I dont know what to do? please help me here. [/quote] Discuss.
[COLOR='Red']EDIT: I did not write this! This was just something funny I found on the net! D;

item.title: How to deal with a cheat
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
Mr.Shadow:

If I have spend money on my girlfriend for 2 years,and I never got ANY sex only kisses while she was fucking with another man I’d be pretty pissed. This guy has the right to beat her. That doesn’t mean it’s solving anything or is good,but he has the right. Or take a better revenge and,as stated before,have sex with all her female friends. Or at least one(maybe her best friend,not the man kind but the girlfriend). Then she’d kinda know how it feels to be cheated on.

I almost feel like I have the right to beat you.

Read full topic
item.source: How to deal with a cheat

item.title: How to deal with a cheat
item.dc:creator: raw_bean
item.description:
No-one has ‘the right’ to beat anyone, you moron. It’s illegal and unethical and childish, and when the person in question is physically weaker or smaller than yourself (as a woman normally is compared to a man) then it’s disgusting and cowardly bullying. Cheating is detestable, but civilised adults are supposed to have better ways of dealing with things.

Read full topic

item.description:
Jeg kan taler lidt dansk.

I guess Danish pronunciation and spelling is pretty strange too. Spanish doesn’t have any silent letters, besides h but that’s all the time, that I can think of. I really want to learn Italian though, and I wish they had it instead of French. Japanese too. And Russian. And Arabic.

:fffuuu: Too many languages!

item.title: How to deal with a cheat
item.dc:creator: Imonfire
item.description:
Actually I for one prefer the European French way of speaking. “Joual”, the way we Québecer say things, is very different from the “Arpitan” or the “Roman”, french way of speaking, but I however think that most of Québecers uses Joual as an excuse to butcher French. I think Joual sounds more, well, I wouldn’t say Barbaric, but close. Note that my opinion doesn’t represent the opinion of Québecers in general. It’s actually the opposite.

Read full topic
item.source: How to deal with a cheat

item.title: How to deal with a cheat
item.dc:creator: Winged_One
item.description:
Oh, I didn’t see the reference to English being related to French.

While English is Germanic in origin, much of its vocabulary comes from Latin, the work of trading. For example, “kettle”.

Read full topic
item.source: How to deal with a cheat

item.title: How to deal with a cheat
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
Imonfire:

There are a lot of languages where some letters are “mute”. Actually pretty much all languages that comes from Latin (Romance* languages to be precise) have those mute letters. English got them too since it originates from French and Celtic and Saxon dialects.

*The word Romance in that case if from the latin word romanice, which comes from the expression “romanice loqui”, which means “to speak in latin”. So basically it means languages whose origins are latin.[/SIZE]

English is a Germanic language. The only influence it has from French is in vocabulary.
In a lot of the cases of unpronounced letters in English it is the result of the pronunciation changing over time, and the spelling not following that change, like is the case with knee.

Read full topic
item.source: How to deal with a cheat

item.title: How to deal with a cheat
item.dc:creator: Imonfire
item.description:
Mr.Shadow:

That’s what i think all the time. Why do they have letters in their words when they don’t pronounce it like that?! It’s ridiculous and unnecesary. It sounds awesome,but common! Have some logic in they way of how you write your language. No offence though to French people and people who invented French.

There are a lot of languages where some letters are “mute”. Actually pretty much all languages that comes from Latin (Romance* languages to be precise) have those mute letters. English got them too since it originates from French and Celtic and Saxon dialects.

*The word Romance in that case if from the latin word romanice, which comes from the expression “romanice loqui”, which means “to speak in latin”. So basically it means languages whose origins are latin.[/SIZE]

Read full topic
item.source: How to deal with a cheat

item.title: How to deal with a cheat
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
Mont_Blanc, Mr.Shadow meant that you don’t pronounce the ‘le’ at the end of appelle.
Mr.Shadow, Mont_Blanc thought you meant you don’t pronounce the ‘elle’ at the end of appelle.

French isn’t the only language that has elements that aren’t pronounced. English is and Dutch also have those, and English is at least as bad as French in that department.

Read full topic
item.source: How to deal with a cheat

well I was wrong about Je m’appelle and we don’t speak the last syllable and since we have to learn the accents(I don’t know why) I thought it was spoken like that by French people as well.

item.title: How to deal with a cheat
item.dc:creator: Mont_Blanc
item.description:
Mr.Shadow:

:facepalm: No because an i is pronounced as ay so I makes more sense then
Je’ Mapelle where you don’t here the last syllable.

Actually we write it “Je m’appelle” and of course we say the last syllable. It’s like you put together map and hell.

Read full topic
